get.summary:
List tasks.
TaskView is requested as such: "v1/tasks?view=BASIC"

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. Filter the task list to include tasks in this project.

parameters.name: name_prefix
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL. Filter the list to include tasks where the name matches this prefix.
If unspecified, no task name filtering is done.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL. Number of tasks to return in one page.
Must be less than 2048. Defaults to 256.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL. Page token is used to retrieve the next page of results.
If unspecified, returns the first page of results.
See ListTasksResponse.next_page_token

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL. Affects the fields included in the returned Task messages.
See TaskView below.

 - MINIMAL: Task message will include ONLY the fields:
  Task.Id
  Task.State
 - BASIC: Task message will include all fields EXCEPT:
  Task.ExecutorLog.stdout
  Task.ExecutorLog.stderr
  TaskParameter.Contents in Task.Inputs
 - FULL: Task message includes all fields.

get.summary:
GetServiceInfo provides information about the service,
such as storage details, resource availability, and 
other documentation.

Get a task.
TaskView is requested as such: "v1/tasks/{id}?view=FULL"

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL. Affects the fields included in the returned Task messages.
See TaskView below.

 - MINIMAL: Task message will include ONLY the fields:
  Task.Id
  Task.State
 - BASIC: Task message will include all fields EXCEPT:
  Task.ExecutorLog.stdout
  Task.ExecutorLog.stderr
  TaskParameter.Contents in Task.Inputs
 - FULL: Task message includes all fields.

tesCancelTaskRequest.description: CancelTaskRequest describes a request to the CancelTask endpoint.

tesCancelTaskResponse.description: CancelTaskResponse describes a response from the CancelTask endpoint.
tesCancelTaskResponse.title: OUTPUT ONLY

id.description: Task identifier assigned by the server.
id.title: REQUIRED

tesCreateTaskResponse.description: CreateTaskResponse describes a response from the CreateTask endpoint.
tesCreateTaskResponse.title: OUTPUT ONLY

image_name.description:
Name of the container image, for example:
ubuntu
quay.io/aptible/ubuntu
gcr.io/my-org/my-image
etc...
image_name.title: REQUIRED

workdir.description:
The working directory that the command will be executed in.
Defaults to the directory set by the container image.
workdir.title: OPTIONAL

stdin.description:
Path inside the container to a file which will be piped
to the command's stdin.
stdin.title: OPTIONAL

stdout.description:
Path inside the container to a file where the command's
stdout will be written to.
stdout.title: OPTIONAL

stderr.description:
Path inside the container to a file where the command's
stderr will be written to.
stderr.title: OPTIONAL

ports.description: Port to expose from within the container, blank if none.
ports.title: OPTIONAL

environ.description: Enviromental variables to set within the container.
environ.title: OPTIONAL

tesExecutor.description: Executor describes a command to run, and its environment.

start_time.description: Time the executor started, in RFC 3339 format.
start_time.title: OPTIONAL

end_time.description: Time the executor ended, in RFC 3339 format.
end_time.title: OPTIONAL

stdout.description:
Stdout tail.
This is not guaranteed to be the entire log.
Implementations determine the maximum size.
stdout.title: OPTIONAL

stderr.description:
Stderr tail.
This is not guaranteed to be the entire log.
Implementations determine the maximum size.
stderr.title: OPTIONAL

ports.description: Ports mapped between the container and host.
ports.title: OPTIONAL

tesExecutorLog.description: ExecutorLog describes logging information related to an Executor.
tesExecutorLog.title: OUTPUT ONLY

view.description:
Affects the fields included in the returned Task messages.
See TaskView below.
view.title: OPTIONAL

tesGetTaskRequest.description: GetTaskRequest describes a request to the GetTask endpoint.

project.description: Filter the task list to include tasks in this project.
project.title: OPTIONAL

name_prefix.description:
Filter the list to include tasks where the name matches this prefix.
If unspecified, no task name filtering is done.
name_prefix.title: OPTIONAL

page_size.description:
Number of tasks to return in one page.
Must be less than 2048. Defaults to 256.
page_size.title: OPTIONAL

page_token.description:
Page token is used to retrieve the next page of results.
If unspecified, returns the first page of results.
See ListTasksResponse.next_page_token
page_token.title: OPTIONAL

view.description:
Affects the fields included in the returned Task messages.
See TaskView below.
view.title: OPTIONAL

tesListTasksRequest.description: ListTasksRequest describes a request to the ListTasks service endpoint.

next_page_token.description:
Token used to return the next page of results.
See TaskListRequest.next_page_token
next_page_token.title: OPTIONAL

tesListTasksResponse.description: ListTasksResponse describes a response from the ListTasks endpoint.
tesListTasksResponse.title: OUTPUT ONLY

url.description: URL of the file in storage, e.g. s3://bucket/file.txt
url.title: REQUIRED

path.description: Path of the file inside the container.
path.title: REQUIRED

size_bytes.description: Size of the file in bytes.
size_bytes.title: REQUIRED

tesOutputFileLog.description:
OutputFileLog describes a single output file. This describes
file details after the task has completed successfully,
for logging purposes.
tesOutputFileLog.title: OUTPUT ONLY

container.description: Port number opened inside the container.
container.title: REQUIRED

host.description:
Port number opened on the host. Must be greater than 1024.
Defaults to 0, which assigns a random port on the host.
host.title: OPTIONAL

tesPorts.description: Ports describes the port mapping between the container and host.

preemptible.description: Is the task allowed to run on preemptible compute instances (e.g. AWS Spot)?
preemptible.title: OPTIONAL

zones.description: Request that the task be run in these compute zones.
zones.title: OPTIONAL

tesResources.description: Resources describes the resources requested by a task.

name.description: Returns the name of the service, e.g. "ohsu-compbio-funnel".

doc.description: Returns a documentation string, e.g. "Hey, we're OHSU Comp. Bio!".

storage.description:
Lists some, but not necessarily all, storage locations supported by the service.

Must be in a valid URL format.
e.g. 
file:///path/to/local/funnel-storage
s3://ohsu-compbio-funnel/storage
etc.

tesServiceInfo.description:
ServiceInfo describes information about the service,
such as storage details, resource availability,
and other documentation.
tesServiceInfo.title: OUTPUT ONLY

tesServiceInfoRequest.description: ServiceInfoRequest describes a request to the ServiceInfo endpoint.

tesState.description:
Task states.

 - PAUSED: An implementation *may* have the ability to pause a task,
but this is not required.
tesState.title: OUTPUT ONLY

id.description: Task identifier assigned by the server.
id.title: OUTPUT ONLY

project.description:
Describes the project this task is associated with.
Commonly used for billing on cloud providers (AWS, Google Cloud, etc).
project.title: OPTIONAL

inputs.description:
Input files.
Inputs will be downloaded and mounted into the executor container.
inputs.title: OPTIONAL

outputs.description:
Output files.
Outputs will be uploaded from the executor container to long-term storage.
outputs.title: OPTIONAL

resources.description: Request that the task be run with these resources.
resources.title: OPTIONAL

executors.description: A list of executors to be run, sequentially.
executors.title: REQUIRED

volumes.description:
Declared volumes.
Volumes are shared between executors. Volumes for inputs and outputs are 
inferred and should not be delcared here.
volumes.title: OPTIONAL

tags.description: A key-value map of arbitrary tags.
tags.title: OPTIONAL

logs.description:
Task logging information.
Normally, this will contain only one entry, but in the case where
a task fails and is retried, an entry will be appended to this list.
logs.title: OUTPUT ONLY

tesTask.description: Task describes an instance of a task.

metadata.description: Arbitrary logging metadata included by the implementation.
metadata.title: OPTIONAL

start_time.description: When the task started, in RFC 3339 format.
start_time.title: OPTIONAL

end_time.description: When the task ended, in RFC 3339 format.
end_time.title: OPTIONAL

outputs.description:
Information about all output files. Directory outputs are
flattened into separate items.
outputs.title: REQUIRED

tesTaskLog.description: TaskLog describes logging information related to a Task.
tesTaskLog.title: OUTPUT ONLY

url.description:
URL in long term storage, for example:
s3://my-object-store/file1
gs://my-bucket/file2
file:///path/to/my/file
/path/to/my/file
etc...
url.title: REQUIRED

path.description: Path of the file inside the container.
path.title: REQUIRED

type.description: Type of the file, FILE or DIRECTORY
type.title: REQUIRED

contents.description:
File contents literal. 
Implementations should support a minimum of 128 KiB in this field and may define its own maximum.
UTF-8 encoded
contents.title: OPTIONAL

tesTaskParameter.description: TaskParameter describes input and output files for a Task.

tesTaskView.description:
TaskView affects the fields returned by the ListTasks endpoint.

Some of the fields in task can be large strings (e.g. logs),
which can be a burden on the network. In the default BASIC view,
these heavyweight fields are not included, however, a client may
request the FULL version to include these fields.

 - MINIMAL: Task message will include ONLY the fields:
  Task.Id
  Task.State
 - BASIC: Task message will include all fields EXCEPT:
  Task.ExecutorLog.stdout
  Task.ExecutorLog.stderr
  TaskParameter.Contents in Task.Inputs
 - FULL: Task message includes all fields.
